data.title: Wine story in Kutjevo
data.meta_description:
Price per person: 55 EUR/414.40 kn

Price includes:


	overnight stay with breakfast in a double room in the center of Kutjevo at Wellnes B&B Winery Sontacchi (https://www.sontacchi-vinarija.hr/) (near famous wineries)
	guided tasting of Sontacchi wine in the wine cellar 
	guided wine
data.text:
Price per person: 55 EUR/414.40 kn

Price includes:

overnight stay with breakfast in a double room in the center of Kutjevo at Wellnes B&B Winery Sontacchi (https://www.sontacchi-vinarija.hr/) (near famous wineries)

guided tasting of Sontacchi wine in the wine cellar

guided wine tasting at the winery Kutjevo

Optional:

possibility of using wellness and spa facilities with an extra charge of 20 euros per person (stay up to 3 hours)

possibility of visiting other Kutjevo wineries, it is possible to visit the Krauthaker and Galić wineries on foot the

possibility of free use of bicycles

possibility of hiking from the building along marked hiking trails

possibility of organizing themed evenings within the facility

We recommend:

tour of the Papuk and Jankovac Nature Parks (distance about 26 km)

adrenaline park Duboka (zip line for children and adults) - open since March bicycle rental in the adrenaline park.

The Kutjevo area is a well-known wine and viticulture area with a rich historical and cultural heritage, and Kutjevo itself is known as the Croatian wine capital. Vines were grown here as early as the time of the ancient Romans. Since 1232, with the construction of the wine cellars of the Cistercian monastery in Kutjevo, top wines have been produced. Specific natural conditions made it possible for the Graševina and Riesling wine varieties to produce excellent white wines. Kutjevo is part of Požega's "Golden Valley". In the heart of the Papuk Nature Park is the Jankovac Forest Park, which is the most famous mountain excursion site in Slavonia, with lakes and waterfalls reminiscent of a smaller version of the Plitvice Lakes.
